data.title: China: Subjects: Chiang Kai-shek correspondence, April 1961-September 1963
data.meta_description: This folder contains correspondence between President John F. Kennedy and President of the Republic of China Chiang Kai-shek. Topics include the representation of China (Peoples Republic) in the United Nations (UN), the Republic of China’s opposition to representation of Outer Mongolia in the UN, relations between the Soviet Union and the People’s Republic of China, and relations between the United States and the Republic of China.
data.meta_site_name: John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum
data.text:
About Folder

Title

China: Subjects: Chiang Kai-shek correspondence, April 1961-September 1963

Collection

Papers of John F. Kennedy. Presidential Papers. National Security Files

Finding Aid | Digitized Content

Digital Identifier

JFKNSF-026-005

Folder Description

This folder contains correspondence between President John F. Kennedy and President of the Republic of China Chiang Kai-shek. Topics include the representation of China (Peoples Republic) in the United Nations (UN), the Republic of China’s opposition to representation of Outer Mongolia in the UN, relations between the Soviet Union and the People’s Republic of China, and relations between the United States and the Republic of China.

Extent / Physical Description

139 digital pages

Series

Series 01. Countries.

Preferred Citation

Papers of John F. Kennedy. Presidential Papers. National Security Files. Countries. China: Subjects: Chiang Kai-shek correspondence, April 1961-September 1963. JFKNSF-026-005. John F. Kennedy Presidential Library and Museum
